page.description: The B directive sets the border style for a button. When you have multiple directives in a Format string, you separate them with semi-colons ";".

argument.name: X
argument.description: Character. The border style of the button. The default is the normal button style.

case.description: "F" = Left and top aligned with a 3D border when the mouse is over it.
"G" = Draw grid lines when part of anchor buttons in a resizable list box.
"N" = Left and top aligned with no outline. Often used to create web style buttons.
"T" = Has a colored background when the mouse is over it. Often used to create menu style buttons.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example shows different border styles.
The following example creates an invisible button (a hot spot) that is one line high and one character wide.
section.example: ui_dlg_box("Sample",<<%dlg% ... <%B=N%1,1!hide_button_click> ... %dlg%,<<%code% if a_dlg_button = "hide_button_click" ' the action you want for the "hotspot" a_dlg_button = "" end if %code%)
